title: Import SAM demo data into Service Management
content:
For demonstration purposes, we can import SAM demo data into Service Management, including the Person, Company, Asset Model, License, Contract, and Device record types by utilizing the Integration Studio functionality.

To complete the SAM demo data import, follow the steps below.

Create an endpoint

  1. Log in to the agent interface as the tenant admin.
  2. Navigate to Administration > Utilities > Integration > Endpoints. 
  3. Click Add.
  4. Select Rest Executor 2.0 as the endpoint type, enter SAM as the endpoint name, and then click Add. The system creates the endpoint. 
  5. Click Configure, and then complete the following fields.
    Field Value
    Agent

    Select Agentless.
    Authentication type Select SMAX.
    Protocol Select https.
    Base URL Enter the base URL of the Service Management system: https://<FQDN>
     
    Tenant ID Enter the tenant ID of the Service Management tenant admin.
    Username Enter the username of the Service Management tenant admin.
    Password Enter the password of the Service Management tenant admin. 
    Confirm password Re-enter the password.
    Certificate type Select X.509.
    Certificate format Select PEM.
    Server certificate
    1. Open the tenant URL in a web browser and export the root CA certificate to a file in the base-64 encoded format. 
    2. Open the certificate file in a text editor, and then copy and paste the content to this field. If the content is invalid, an error occurs when you click Save in the next step. 

    The certificate content must resemble the example provided below.

    -----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----
MIIF2TCCBMGgAwIBAgIQBMF1U8hY8bivE0+JHx922jANBgkqhkiG9w0BAQsFADBG
MQswCQYDVQQGEwJVUzEPMA0GA1UEChMGQW1hem9uMRUwEwYDVQQLEwxTZXJ2ZXIg
Q0EgMUIxDzANBgNVBAMTBkFtYXpvbjAeFw0yMTEwMTEwMDAwMDBaFw0yMjExMDky
MzU5NTlaMBsxGTAXBgNVBAMTEHhpZS5pdHNtYS1uZy5vcmcwggEiMA0GCSqGSIb3
1oIvQfpl2gj0S6JSJAYjJnY7HKCa7mkzBMiiXWI5aHMZfl1FsaNARM10LUpto61f
Ivk/SDNlOqVXuzGMTZkJBVZVmK5lNLvBB1Gk9+QlJ+SuUOW7FW2K5U+oQKWsHtvH
C/DHn6yyhvqWes9q6A==
-----END CERTIFICATE-----
  6. Click Save. The system displays a message indicating the endpoint configuration has been successfully saved.

Import the integration

  1. From the agent interface, select Administration > Utilities > Integration > Integration Studio.
  2. Click  in the left pane, and then click Import.
  3. In the Import dialog, select the SAM Sample Data-SMAX.pkb file that's unzipped from the corresponding SAM Sample Data package downloaded from the Marketplace, and then click Open.
  4. Click Upload, and configure these settings on the Detail page.
    • Make sure to select the Active checkbox.
    • Enter a name for the integration.
    • Set the Target endpoint field as SAM.
    • Click the icon next to the Current system integration user field. In the Credentials window that pops up, enter the UPN and password of the integration user created for the Service Management tenant admin.
  5. Click Save and wait for the system to display a Success message.
If you encounter an import error indicating that the imported file size exceeds the limitation, you will need to set the Max Dev2Prod package file size value configured on the tenant's Application settings form in Suite Administration to be larger than the imported file size. For SaaS customers, contact the SaaS Operations team.

Configure and run the scenario

After creating the endpoint and importing the integration, you need to configure and run the OOTB scenarios in the integration:

  1. Locate the [Sub process]: Import record data scenario.
  2. In the Listener section, keep URL Token unchanged for Authentication type and click Generate to create a webhook URL. Go to the General section and select Active to activate the scenario. Then, save the setting.
  3. Locate the [Sub process]: Configure SAM scenario and repeat step 2.
  4. Locate the [Main process]: Simulate compliance calculation scenario and click Run scenario. This scenario will invoke the information configured in the above two scenarios.
  5. Verify that the SAM demo data, including the Person, Company, Asset Model, License, Contract, and Device record types, are ready in your Service Management environment.
